title: Saudi crown prince threatened ‘major’ economic pain on U.S. amid oil feud
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman threatened to upend U.S.-Saudi relations amid a dispute over oil cuts last year, leaked intelligence shows.

title: Texas to install floating barriers in Rio Grande to block migrants
description: Texas Gov. Abbott announced plans to install floating barriers in the middle of the Rio Grande to block migrants from reaching the U.S. side of the river.

title: The smoke will fade in the U.S. But cities across the globe aren’t so lucky.
description: The burning of fossil fuels, along with wildfires exacerbated by climate change, have created what some experts describe as the biggest danger to global public health.

title: Satellite images show the devastation from the Kakhovka dam collapse
description: The damage from the dam collapse in Ukraine can be seen from the sky.

title: Ukraine’s counteroffensive is underway. Here’s what’s at stake.
description: While Russia has gained little territory since the fall, it has had time to fortify.

title: In scramble for EV metals, health threat to workers often goes unaddressed
description: South Africa is the world’s largest producer of manganese, but the EV industry has done little to protect miners from the neurological hazards of the mineral.

title: Ukrainian military begins counteroffensive to oust Russian occupiers
description: Ukrainian soldiers, including specialized attack units armed with Western weapons and trained in NATO tactics, advanced on Russian positions in Zaporizhzhia.

title: USAID cuts food aid supporting millions of Ethiopians amid charges of massive government theft
description: Ethiopian officials have been diverting aid from the needy to feed soldiers and selling it on the open market for reexport, according to an investigation by the U.S. Agency for International Development that was summarized to The Post.

title: Being a commando in Hebron damaged him. Protesting Netanyahu helps him heal.
description: After guarding settlers in Hebron, he left the military with a severe case of PTSD. Now he is healing himself and, he hopes, his country through protests.

title: Children injured in knife attack in southeast France, police say
description: France's interior minister said an individual responsible for the stabbing attack that injured four children in Annecy was arrested.

title: They were flying to the U.S. Then, they spent 40 hours stranded in Russia.
description: Air India Flight 173, from New Delhi to San Francisco, made an emergency landing in a remote city, where passengers slept in a school gymnasium.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky calls for international aid as flood evacuations continue
description: Ukraine's president described the conditions in Russian-occupied areas as “absolutely catastrophic” — with people abandoned on rooftops, without water.

title: Hong Kong prisons work to compel loyalty to China among young activists
description: Former activists in Hong Kong’s 2019 fight for greater democratic freedoms are now the latest subjects in China’s decades-long experiment in political control.

title: Ukraine’s counteroffensive won’t be an easy retread of last year’s wins
description: The battlefield has changed over the past year for both Ukraine and Russia.

title: Ukraine flood victims ferried to safety; shelling intensifies after dark
description: The still-unexplained collapse of the Kakhovka dam has forced Ukrainians from their homes.
